name: wooden
content:
wooden adjective
(WOOD)
Add to word list
Add to word list
A2 made of wood: The house was surrounded by a tall, wooden fence. Stir the mixture with a wooden spoon.
More examplesFewer examplesWe could hear the clump of his feet on the wooden floor.This wooden instrument is the ancestor of the modern metal flute.The top of the wooden chest was inlaid with ivory.Her eyes rested on a small wooden box at the back of the shop.The floor is held up by wooden supports.

wooden adjective
(AWKWARD)
disapproving used to describe behaviour that is awkward or shows little expression: She gave a wooden smile to the camera. I thought the lead actor gave rather a wooden performance.

wooden adjective
(MADE OF HARD MATERIAL)
Add to word list
Add to word list
[ not gradable ] made of wood: They ate at a long wooden table.
wooden adjective
(AWKWARD)
stiff and awkward, or lacking expression: She’s a wooden speaker.
